metadata.Title: CVE-2018-21035 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Qt through 5.14.1, the WebSocket implementation accepts up to 2GB for frames and 2GB for messages. Smaller limits cannot be configured. This makes it easier for attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-21035` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libqt5websockets5 - 5.15.1-2
qml-module-qt-websockets - 5.15.1-2
qml-module-qtwebsockets - 5.15.1-2
qtwebsockets5-examples - 5.15.1-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> upstream commit just adds new settings allowing users to lower allowed frame/message size, it doesn't change the default behaviour

criterions.comment: qtwebsockets-opensource-src package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.1-2').
